text: On tap at DDC St-Jerome. This is a simple blonde beer, or what you may find as the closest to that at DDC. By that I mean a light beer, with a fresh taste, a bit fruity/citrus and with a small amount of bitterness. Nothing fancy, just a nicely tasting little blonde beer.

Draft @ ML Fontainas, 3ième fête de la St Jean, shared with Rlgk and _Angst_.
Fin doré, col blanc.
Arôme au nez assez belge sur les effluve de levures, fruité apporte une certaine balance et des effluves tropicales.
Palais est léger versant de suite sur un style belge, sec et finemetn terreux, le tout est relevé par un houblonné noble mais aussi une impression plus accrocheuse de fruité, citronnelle, presque de Sorachi.

Verre en fût. Dégustée à la brasserie de Saint-Jérôme le 10 août 2014. Bière blonde pâle voilée.. Col mince blanc persistant, pratiquement aucune effervescence. Odeur de pamplemousse rose marquée. Très douce, peu sucrée, assez amère et plutôt sèche en finale. Saveur de pamplemousse bien présente, de pêches et de fleurs.

Draught at Moeder Lambic Fontainas Attention Passage De Brasseurs 160623. Hazy golden beer with a rich offwhite head. Fruity hay aroma, citrus, yeast notes, floral, some caramel. Hoppy yeasty flavor, grapes, floral, bready, caramel, slightly spicy.

Sample @DDC Montreal. Aroma: lemon, green hops, abricot, floral. App: hazy straw, minimal white head, good lacing sticking to my glass. Taste and palate: light to medium body, floral in mouth as well, dry light bitter finish. Overall: pretty good. Awesome mouthfeel. Not much to say about it. Its light, resinous a tad and refreshing.

Pours a cloudy pale yellow gold with a white head. Light lemon aroma. Light body, medium carbonation. Lots of lemon, white bread, orange. OK. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

En fût à la brasserie. Cest avec un grand sourire quÉlise me sert ce verre à la couleur du blé dansant dans les champs. Une belle mousse malheureusement peu tenace trône sur ce liquide frais et plein de vie. Un nez estival où je retrouve de la mie de pain, des graines de pavot et du citron. Ça me rappelle le délicieux gâteau au citron de ma mère! En bouche léquilibre des textures est parfait! La Belgique est davantage représentée par ce houblonnage à leuropéenne que par la rondeur ou la levure caractéristique du pays. Liquide très léger supporté par un blé frais qui ne fait pas défaut et dont les saveurs moyennement complexes adoptent un profil principalement aromatique. Absolument délicieuse!

En fut à la brasserie de Saint-Jérôme. Bière jaune paille voilée et surmontée dune épaise mousse blanche crèmeuse eaffichant une belle tenue et laissant une belle dentelle sur le verre. Au nez, ellle dévoile des arômes de pain, de citron, dépices, de houblons nobles, et de levure. En bouche, elle offre des notes de pain, de blé, de foin, de citron, de levure, de poivre blanc, de levure belge et se termine par une finale légèrement amère. Corps moyen, effervescence modérée. Très bonne blonde belge.
On draft at the brewery. It is a cloudy light gold with an off white head. The aroma is citrus and the taste has hints of lemon and pepper  with a somewhat bitter finish.
On draft at the brewery. Pours a hazy pale gold with an off white head. Light fruity nose. Floral flavors. Light and delicate. Slight bitter finish. Refreshing.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2015 On draught at the brewery, 4/18/15Very lightly hazy, soft-hued blonde body is topped by a large white head that slowly recedes to cover.Lightly spicy (hops and yeast) in the nose with plentiful sweet biscuity malt notes to go along with it. Bits of sourdough, hay and honey as it warms with light vanilla and a hard water note as well (minerals). Smells good, like that its more phenolic and malt focused as opposed to the usual estery blonde ale. No alcohol or flaws.A solid medium bodied drinkable ale, with light spiciness coming from the hops. Seem German, very spalter-like with pepper and earthy notes. Sourdough and light honey give perhaps a bit too much maltiness, but the carbonation helps keep it fairly light. Its a very robust 4% beer, which, if you are looking for a low abv flavorful beer, seems perfect for the occasion.

12 onz draft @ mtl pub A: citrusy, wheat, herbacy app: hazy pale small white. T/p: thin med body with moderate long acidic finish. Soft to moderate carbonation. O: pretty good. A nice refreshing ale. Could see myself drinking it again on a terrace.
Draft - Hoppy, funky, grass with a bit of perfume. Cloudy gold with a rich white head. Grassy, funky and wheat. Smells so good, wish flavour matched.
Couleur jaune legerement trouble avec un beau col blanc. Aromes dagrumes depices et de cereales. Cest bien balancer. Interessante!

UPDATED: APR 2, 2015 Tap at Bateau de Nuit. Pours a heavily cloudy golden with a thin white head that still manages to leave nice lacing. Nose is of pepper, fruits, citrus and lightly wheaty. Taste is of same fruits and light lemon with pepper over a crisp cereals base. Body is light and carbonation high and a little prickly. Overall a really nice belgian ale, ultra drinkable!

On tap at the brewery. Pour is pale cloudy gold with minimal head/retention/lacing. Nose is wheat and lemon with a bit of spice. Taste is wheat, lemon and yeast spice. Finish is dry and subtly bitter with a bit of lingering spice. Nice and light and drinkable. Patio beer
Pale golden pour. Bright spiciness and a bit of lemon peel and yeasty tartness. Fresh and dry with a lingering grassy finish. Fresh and a bit peppery.

on tap at la souche, qc. hazy very light yellow pour with a very nice white head, good retention and lacing. floral and spicy citrus, lime juice, some lemons, lean very pale spicy maltiness, very yeasty - belgiany indeed, pepper, pinch of dirt. average to light carbonation, light body - slighly watery, assertive earthy-citrusy-herbal finish. clean and nice light belgian ale.

Wallonade 4% on tap at the brewpub this is a very pale straw gold with a thin filmy white head and a hop forward fruity Belgian aroma. Nice! Medium bodied with a spritzy zesty lively carbonation. The taste is lemon citrus bitter, a bit wheaty/bready but is is simply a clean delicious beer.

Pours light straw yellow with a moderate white foamy head. Aroma is grassy malts, yeast and citrus fruit. Taste is light grass and citrus with the dry belgian yeast. This one was down the line at the National Capital Beerfest.

On tap at Festibière 2014
Pours blond with medium white head. Some lacing. Aroma and taste are pretty yeasty, fruits, malt, citrus. Palate: Light body. Overall: Very tasty and refreshing. Crafty yeast action. Pretty belgian.

On tap @ Dieu du Ciel, Montreal, Canada - Color: clear blond beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: sweety nose, really floral. Taste: nice balance, really drinkable. Malty domination. Aftertaste: nice sweet bitterness and floral notes.

[ Keg ][ 4oz ][ Dieu du Ciel Montréal ][ $2 ][ Flared Tasting Flute ][ 5/26/14 ]
>> Clear straw pour, good white foam. Super fruity honeydew and lime honey nose, noble hops. Taste is clean, white grape, paper, too chalky. Still pretty nice. Palate is tangy, a tad fizzy, nice tartness, lemonade. Possible to give this a better palate score as it warms. Impressive beer all around.
Blonde quasi blanche. Très pâle. Céréale. Levuré. Pêche. Très légère. Belle amertume. Florale. Citronné. Rafraichissante.

Hazy white color with a small persistent foam collar. Aromas of Belgian yeast, wheat, light fruity hops. Flavors announced by the nose with a nice dry finish. Couleur blanche trouble avec un petit col de mousse persistant. Nez de levure belge, blé, houblon un peu fruité. Saveurs annoncée par le nez avec une finale sèche agréable.

On tap at Festibière de Gatineau 2014. Clear pale yellow with a foamy white head. Flavors are cereals, citrus, yeast, honey and tea with herbal and spicy notes. Light body, moderate to high carbonation, thin texture.

Mousse blanche copieuse, soutenue par une effervescence importante. La bière a une couleur paille plutôt pâle, et est relativement trouble. Odeurs de blé et dagrumes douces. Semble très effervescente. En bouche, on découvre des saveurs houblonnées complexes et aromatiques, tout en apportant une certaine amertume qui lassèche agréablement. On jurerait quelle contient du blé également, surtout que les céréales prennent clairement le haut du pavé en fin de gorgée. Excellente, savoureuse et désaltérante, elle nest pas exactement passionnante, mais elle présente de bien séduisantes qualités pour une bière simple à la base, mais finalement plutôt originale.

Glass, 4-ounce, draught, draught, during the Mondial de la bière, savoured on May 29 2013; eye: yellowish with a milky hue, hazy, no effervescence, nice white head that turns into a tiny ring, nice lacing; nose: citrusy, light hops, light wheat, light fruity; mouth: citrusy, freshness, light floral hops, wheat, acidity, banana, finale in wheat with presence of acidity, medium body, good carbonation, slightly bitter and sweet, slick texture; overall: quite fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Verre, 4 onces, en fût, bue lors du Mondial de la bière, savourée le 29 mai 2013; il : jaunâtre avec une teinte laiteuse, voilée, pas deffervescence, belle mousse blanche qui se transforme en un petit anneau, bonne dentelle; nez : citrique, léger houblon, léger blé, léger fruité; bouche : citrique, fraîcheur, léger houblon floral, blé, acidité, banane, finale en blé avec présence dacidité, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, très légèrement amère et sucrée, texture coulante; en résumé : très bon
An interesting beer on tap at DDC, Montreal. Kind of an herbal element to this which is interesting.
sample at The Festival, blonde pour, great sessionable beer at 4%. Floral, fruity yeastiness. good flavor. touch of citrus & herbal notes. very nice

Sampled at THE FESTIVAL 2013 with Andrew, Jay and Kramer. Pours an amber body with light lacing. Aroma is yeast, light funk, must and dust. Mouthfeel is medium with similar notes - plus flowers, spice and herbal character. Somewhat restrained overall, but Im typically not a fan of the style and this was really enjoyable.

From draft @ The Festival. Clear yellow with a medium white head and good lacing. Aroma if mainly floral and herbal with some yeastiness. Taste is slightly sweet and about the same as aroma. Light body. Moderate carbonation. Good sessionnable Belgian Ale. Not extremely tasty, but still fun to drink, especially at 4% abv.
tap at the festival. soft herbs. rustic. dry. pretty nice beer. refreshing.
Pours straw and slightly cloudy. Notes of lemon and other fruit. Refreshing with all the citrus. Medium carbonation and body is quite lite. Solid effort.

On tap.
Appearance : Clear pale yellow with small white head. Some lacing.

Aroma : Great fresh fluffy and chewy malts with herbal hops. Delightful yeast.

Taste : Yeasty with herbal hops. Lots of malt on the finish with more herbal hops. Some hay. Long finish.

Overall : Really nice offering. Packed with flavor which is an accomplishment in itself considering the low abv. Nice belgian yeast, nice malt. nice body. Great stuff.

Dégustée en fût sur place à Montréal. De couleur jaune pâle et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (agrumes,surtout de citron,  traces de bananes) aux notes épicées (coriandre), léger de céréales sucrées et de houblon herbeux aux notes florales ainsi quavec des notes de blé. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture aux notes crémeuses. Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes sucrées et très citronnées) aux petites notes épicées lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de grains de céréales avec des notes de pain et de blé puis en finale lon retrouve un légère amertume de houblon herbeux avec quelques traces florales. Post-goût moyen, légèrement amer de houblon herbeux avec un goût fruité (zeste dagrumes). (25 mars 2012)

On tap at Dieu du Ciel. The color is a hazy blond with a thin beige head and nice lace.The aroma in citrusy and hoppy. The taste also of citrus fruits mostly lemons, hops,spicies,and a bit of a mineral taste added on some malt.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel, pours a clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of crisp grassy hops, Belgian yeast and mild candied sugar. Flavour is very light and restrained - tastes very Belgiany, with light yeast and light sweetness. Soft palate. Quite decent.
On tap at DDC. Pours very pale yellow with a small creamy head. Aroma of pilsner, belgian yeast, grass - very feint. Flavour of yeast, some butter, water, grass and hay. Not very exciting. Delicate.

On tap at DDC (Montreal). Pours clear blond with some lacing. Aroma: fruits, malt, grain, herb, citrus and hops. Taste is sweet with a bitter finish. Surprisingly good for a light beer. Easily drinkable. Refreshing
Consommée directement chez Dieu du Ciel. En fut. Arôme finement distinctif de houblon herbal. Ombrageux. Faible effervescence. Goût herbeux.

En fût. Verre de 12 oz dégusté directement à la brasserie. Arôme: Légère odeur de citron et dépices. Apparence: La couleur est blonde pâle très légèrement voilée. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de céréales et de citron avec une pointe dépices. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement citronné. (Rating #4276)

Style et résumé: Ale belge agréable et aromatique.  
Comment: Une pinte rue Laurier en bonne compagnie Boul et Pat. 
Description: Bière blonde dorée avec une mousse blanche crémeuse. Cette mousse crémeuse est durable et avait encore une vie devant quand le verre était vide. Le nez est de houblon sentant bon le citron, les agrumes (du Citra et du Nelson Sauvin?). La bouche est fraîche, elle coule bien. Il semble avoir du Citra ou du Nelson tant le citron et les herbes (foin) sont présents. Une amertume appréciable en fin de bouche. Une superbe bière.
Note:  8/10

Un verre sur la rue Laurier.  Une robe jaune pâle bien embrouillée.  Une tête mousseuse dense et persistente.  Magnifique.  Un nez formidablement citronné avec des fleurs et des herbes.  Une rafale de céréales qui donnent une impression épicée (blé, pils?) avec le souffle tranquille dune levure au profil rustique.  Des saveurs bien houblonnées avec une juste présence de céréales bien fraîches.  Un étalement de fruits tropicaux sur mes papilles.  Jhallucine?  Je ne pense pas.  Une bouche construite par la légèreté avec un pétillement actif et une texture fine.  Une conclusion heureuse et asséchante sur des notes amèrement citronnées.  Extrêmement facile à boire et ô combien plaisante.  Vivement un embouteillage de ce fabuleux nectar.
Hazy and amber.  Spicy-yeasty aroma.  Light with a gentle spiciness and balanced pale malt.

Draught at Mondial de la Bière 2012, June 7. Pours a hazy pale yellow-gold with an average size diminishing white head. Aroma is sweet and fruity (citrus and more) along with herbal and perfumy notes, Belgian yeast and some spices. Flavour of yeast, spices & herbs, light tart citrus and light hops. Average bodied. Pretty good.

[4450-20120607] Tap. Sweaty lemon orange pie aroma. Slightly hazy, light orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Soapy floral yeast flavour has a citrusy lemon yeast base. Medium body. Good, at first I didnt care for the aroma but now it makes sense. (6/3/7/3/15) 3.4
(@ Mondial, Montreal, QC)

@Mondial de la Bière 2012, Montreal - hazy pale blond beer with a poor head retention; some dust in the front and with a fair fruity hoppiness; notes of almonds; thin-bodied, slightly astringent; long lasting bitterness; subtle flowery hoppy finish - refreshing and very drinkable

On tap at Wvrst.  Pours a very cloudy straw yellow with modest white head.  Aroma is citric, floral and with Belgian yeast character.  Flavour citrusy, floral, crackery and modestly spicy.  Fine carbonation.  Modest bitterness.  Nice.

Draft: Poured a light dirty beige color ale with a small foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of floral hoppy notes with light funky yeast notes with light rustic malt notes. Taste is also a complex mix between some rustic malt with notes of floral hops with dry notes and some light funky yeast. Body is quite full with good carbonation. A wonder of taste and refreshing notes with minimal ABV  this is something I would like to see more of.

2012-06-07. Hazy pastel yellow, small white head that fades. 3+ Aroma is nice, sort of sharp up front, spicy, coriander or similar? 7+ Flavour has similar spice character, like coriander or maybe lemongrass. 7+ Smooth average bodied palate, modest carbonation. Enjoyable and quite quaffable, I suspect it is better suited to a large glass on a sunny patio than a sample here and might score even higher in that environment. On tap at Mondial, 3T, Montreal
Mondial de la bière à Montréal 2012. Fraîche en bouche, houblon, céréales. 4% et plein de goût. Levures belges. Bonne.

Tap at the. Rewpib. 
Great, clean, refreshing belgian ale. These guys are some of the best whe it comes to this style. Great hoppy aroma, sme sharp pine, and light tropical fruit. Lovely light cereal malts, and even some slight yeast. Great refreshing sharp hops in the finish with a medium bitterness. The ultimate patio session ale!!

Draft at brewpub. Hazy blonde, delicate lace . Dry, Duvel-like aroma. Soft. Refined yeast character makes for a sophisticated beer. Dry, almost astringent. Gorgeous hopping, solid body. Perfect pocket of dry, light, but characterful and mature beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

In short: A semi-tart witbier-ish ale with light rustic notes and fun refreshing hopping.  Kick-ass thirst beer.
How: Tap at brewpub
The look: Cloudy yellow body topped by a persistent small white head
In long: Nose has lemongrass, wheat (not even sure it uses wheat) with herbal and spicy notes.  Taste has a nice wheaty crisp crackery malt backbone, dried flowers, lemon zest, mildly rustic Belgian yeast, assertive flowery/herbal hops with a citric and spicy edge.   Light fruity notes of bananas and some other refreshing light color fruits.  Taste like the bastard child of a superb Witbier and a superb Berliner Weisse with a generous hopping to top it all.  One of a kind.  Fantastic thirst quencher, a beer that I would drink gallons of, one of the best new DDC creation is a long time.  How I wish technology would allow me to copy-and-paste my ass to a chair in Dieu Du Ciel pub just about now.

loudy honey blonde hue, with a white head, yeasty, lemon, grapefruit esters in the nose, with a light lemongrass, coriander, floral spicy herbal, leafy hop accent, with a soft honeyed grainy pale, wheat malt cereal note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty fruity citrusy, flowery lemon, grapefruit peel, leafy, grassy hop character with some faint lemongrass, ginger, dry lime rind flavors, and a light honeyish bready, wheat, pale, toasted grainy malt, doughy backbone, leading towards a hoppy fruity, zesty, lemon, grapefruit peel bittering finish.

On tap at the brewpub. Hazy pale blond body with an average white foamy head. Fresh malty/hoppy aroma with citrusy hints. Its fresh hoppy taste carries coriander and honeyish notes. Ends with a decent bitter/herbal finish. Refreshing.

Verre de 20 oz, au brewpub de Montréal. Arômes complexes de levure fruitée et de houblon épicé et citronné. Robe blonde pâle et légèrement trouble, belle mousse qui tient bien et effervescence veloutée. En bouche, une belle base de malt pilsner croustillant supporte une levure belge aux accents de pain frais et de fruits. Légère présence de gomme balloune. Un beau houblon épicé et citronné contribue à la complexité et mène à une finale sèche et moyennement amère. Vraiment une belle bière de soif.

My Bottom Line:
Spicy hops, intricate fruit esters and svelte cereals coalesce into a subtly floral entity for a supremely drinkable Belgian-style Ale.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A healthy dollop of foam laces all around the veiled blond.
-While the cereal character is nicely defined, oats and rye are far from overt in the flavor profile even though they were generously used.
-This beer is proof there can be as much flavor in a 4% ale as there can be in a 6-7% brew of the same ilk. Hopefully this will inspire some Québécois brewers who tend to dial in their lighter brews.
-Hops are as beautiful from the aroma to the finish, and well leveled too.

On tap at the brewpub.

On tap at DDC. Beautiful milky pale yellow with thin head. Looks like a lemonade. Aroma is very discrete, mostly hay, some cereal, citrusy hops. This one is incredibly refreshing, lots of tart lemon notes balanced with some hop bitterness. Light bodied and medium-lively carbonation. Exactly my type of beer.

Tap. Light to moderate hay for the malts, moderate perfume, pine and lemon for the hops, light must and sweat for the yeast, with hints of banana, pineapple, ginger and clove. Head is average size, creamy, white with excellent lacing and is mostly lasting.Color is hazy, pale yellow. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and lightly to moderately bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery with a lively carbonation. Probably the best smelling Belgian Ale Ive had, with tropical fruits and spices. The hop profile is awesome, and the flavor has just the right amount of acidity.

A pale hazed yellow ale with a thin creamy white head. In aroma, a smooth herbaceous malt with fruity esters, coriander, light cloves. In mouth, a smooth tingly mineral malt with nice oily and raspy mouthfeel, coriander, cloves, lingering dryness. On tap at brewpub, Feb. 24 2012.

Drank on tap (10 oz) at the Montreal brewpub on February 19, 2012. Blonde white, thin head. Hoppy aroma of wheat, gentle cereals. Light taste of lemon and herbs, lightly spiced and very efferversant, bitter herbs and hops. An easy but tasty to drink Belgian!

Enjoyed on tap at the brewpub.  delightfully crafted.  Very good drinkability, a thin crown head.  Subtle yeast, lightly sweet, lacey.  Nice Belgian taste with some fruitiness.I wish this was in Toronto on tap all day every day, I would transition people over by the boatload.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel prior to our trip to the ice cider Mondial.  Pours a lightly hazed gold with a large white head.  Soft light musk on the nose.  Soft wheat, light grain.  Toast, crisp with some light earthy notes.  Touches of grain, light crisp bitterness.  Wonderfully easy drinking.

Tap. Ddc.  Pours hazy blonde.  Big white head some lace. Aroma Is phenolic spicy with some earthy pepper yeast dough and wheat. Flavor is grainy cereal wheat dough spice earth and salty phenol with light fruit. Finish is clean and dry mostly crisp. Good stuff for 4%
